newsitem.title: ITALY: FiatAuto plans 22 Saturdays to boost output.
newsitem.headline: FiatAuto plans 22 Saturdays to boost output.

text.p: Italian car marker Fiat Auto plans 22 working Saturdays in addition to eight already in effect over the coming months to boost car production, a Fiat group source said on Wednesday.
The extra days are planned for different plants and come just a day after Fiat announced it planned to take on an extra 2,000 workers on fixed term contracts to cope with more orders.

The source, speaking on the fringe of a meeting between trade unions and Fiat, said the positive trend in European markets combined with a recovery in the Italian market had required a rise in production capacity in coming months.
A rise in orders in January had continued in February, confirming the positive outlook, the source said.

The Italian government began a car buying incentive scheme on January 7 to run until September 30 which offers incentives for vehicle owners who trade in cars older than 10 years to buy new ones. (( --Milan bureau +392 66129507 ))
